item.title: Ship it - My public journal
item.author: Author
item.description: Inspired by Jen Vermet’s ship-it and weekly letters, I will start to share my thoughts and learnings in public. I love how personal and introspective her thoughts and shared experiences are. I’ve started journaling last year, but my thoughts are mostly very raw and hidden to the outside world. By starting a public journal, I want to challenge myself to become more open and overcome the imposter that my thoughts are not worth being shared.

item.title: Thinking out loud
item.author: Author
item.description: I’m not used to talking about feelings and raw thoughts. It’s how I grew up and it’s hard to undo. Feelings make you vulnerable and I saw them as a burden to others. So I mostly kept them to myself. I found ways to process them: by studying, listening to music, exercising and sleeping. Basically, disengaging from my feelings and letting time heal everything. Time alleviates strong emotions. But I think that this evasive way also disconnects myself from people.
